1.text: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,

2.text: Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

3.text: The sons of Judah: Er, and Onan, and Shelah; which three were born to him of Shua’s daughter the Canaanitess. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of Yahweh; and he killed him.

4.text: Tamar his daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.

5.text: The sons of Perez: Hezron, and Hamul.

6.text: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol, and Dara; five of them in all.

7.text: The sons of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel, who committed a trespass in the devoted thing.

9.text: The sons also of Hezron, who were born to him: Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai.

10.text: Ram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;

11.text: and Nahshon became the father of Salma, and Salma became the father of Boaz,

12.text: and Boaz became the father of Obed, and Obed became the father of Jesse;

13.text: and Jesse became the father of his firstborn Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimea the third,

14.text: Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,

15.text: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh;

16.text: and their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.

17.text: Abigail bore Amasa; and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.

18.text: Caleb the son of Hezron became the father of children of Azubah his wife, and of Jerioth; and these were her sons: Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.

19.text: Azubah died, and Caleb took to him Ephrath, who bore him Hur.

20.text: Hur became the father of Uri, and Uri became the father of Bezalel.

21.text: Afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he took as wife when he was sixty years old; and she bore him Segub.

22.text: Segub became the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.

23.text: Geshur and Aram took the towns of Jair from them, with Kenath, and its villages, even sixty cities. All these were the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.

24.text: After that Hezron was dead in Caleb Ephrathah, then Abijah Hezron’s wife bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.

25.text: The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were Ram the firstborn, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, Ahijah.

26.text: Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.

27.text: The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel were Maaz, and Jamin, and Eker.

28.text: The sons of Onam were Shammai, and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab, and Abishur.

29.text: The name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail; and she bore him Ahban, and Molid.

30.text: The sons of Nadab: Seled, and Appaim; but Seled died without children.

31.text: The sons of Appaim: Ishi. The sons of Ishi: Sheshan. The sons of Sheshan: Ahlai.

32.text: The sons of Jada the brother of Shammai: Jether, and Jonathan; and Jether died without children.

33.text: The sons of Jonathan: Peleth, and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.

34.text: Now Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.

35.text: Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant as wife; and she bore him Attai.

36.text: Attai became the father of Nathan, and Nathan became the father of Zabad,

37.text: and Zabad became the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal became the father of Obed,

38.text: and Obed became the father of Jehu, and Jehu became the father of Azariah,

39.text: and Azariah became the father of Helez, and Helez became the father of Eleasah,

40.text: and Eleasah became the father of Sismai, and Sismai became the father of Shallum,

41.text: and Shallum became the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah became the father of Elishama.

42.text: The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph; and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.

43.text: The sons of Hebron: Korah, and Tappuah, and Rekem, and Shema.

44.text: Shema became the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam; and Rekem became the father of Shammai.

45.text: The son of Shammai was Maon; and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.

46.text: Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, and Moza, and Gazez; and Haran became the father of Gazez.

47.text: The sons of Jahdai: Regem, and Jothan, and Geshan, and Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.

48.text: Maacah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.

49.text: She bore also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbena, and the father of Gibea; and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.

50.text: These were the sons of Caleb, the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,

51.text: Salma the father of Bethlehem, Hareph the father of Beth Gader.

52.text: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim had sons: Haroeh, half of the Menuhoth.

53.text: The families of Kiriath Jearim: The Ithrites, and the Puthites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.

54.text: The sons of Salma: Bethlehem, and the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.

55.text: The families of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, the Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came of Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
